intro: Thesium whyteanum, commonly known as the New Zealand buttercup, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks. Thesium whyteanum has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, elongated seed pods. It is an important component of New Zealand's native flora and is often found in conservation areas.
